      • putAscii

        public static void putAscii(java.lang.String s,
                            java.io.OutputStream os)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Write just the low bytes of a String. (This sucks, but the concept of an encoding seems inapplicable to a binary file ID string. I would think flexibility is just what we don't want - but then again, maybe I'm slow.)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
